intro: Monophyllaea finisterrae, commonly known as the Canary Islands bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It has small, linear leaves and produces seeds in a capsule-like structure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
